original:
Charles Wood is noted for personally witnessing the capture of the Esmeralda frigate, an event that inspired him to create several reproductions of the scene. He is also recognized for his design of the national coat of arms of Chile, marking a significant contribution to the Chilean Republic.

The German artist Mauricio Rugendas and the French artist Ernesto Charton de Treville played pivotal roles in depicting the customs and culture
sampled:
Charles Wood is noted for personally witnessing the capture in the Esmeralda frigate, an event that inspired him to create several reproductions of the scene. He is also recognized for his design of the national coat of arms of Chile, marking a significant contribution to the Chilean Republic.

The German artist Mauricio Rugendas and the French artist Ernesto Charton de Treville played pivotal involvements in depicting the customs and culture
